alert.note: Alert for Bent; Otero (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 06 at 5:08PM MDT until June 06 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WESTERN BENT AND SOUTHEASTERN OTERO COUNTIES... At 508 PM MDT, Trained weather spotters reported heavy rain near Higbee. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. While heavy rain has ended for time being, Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Higbee. This includes the following streams and drainages... Salt Arroyo, Purgatoire River, Jack Canyon, Stevens Draw, Alkali Arroyo and Smith Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
